name: Freebelt Coalition
description: A decentralised network of ex-miners, deserters, scrappers, and anti-authoritarian cells united by hatred of institutional control.
leader: No central leadership; spokesperson known as "Ghostline"

lore.history: Born in the chaos of the Collapse, the Freebelt formed to resist both Hex-Corp exploitation and Directorate overreach. Their improvised fleets are legendary for hit-and-run strikes.
lore.culture: Loose, tribal, individualistic. Freedom above all. No hierarchy lasts long.
lore.goals: Ensure no large power ever rises again; liberate worlds from 'authority'; survive.
lore.notes: They frequently appear in ambush events, sabotage missions, and unexpected rescues.

name: Hex-Corp
description: A powerful pre-Collapse megacorporation that survived by sealing entire research divisions inside hardened orbital vaults. Their influence remains strong in pockets across the Surge.

lore.history: Before the Collapse, Hex-Corp controlled vast chunks of Terran infrastructure. When the Surge tore the galaxy apart, their private fleets and fortified R&D habitats survived better than most. They now operate as a fragmented corporate state.
lore.culture: Rigid hierarchy, financial nobility, loyalty through incentives, and a belief that corporate structure is humanityÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s natural state.
lore.goals: Recover lost assets, secure tech superiority, rebuild a corporate empire.

name: Interstellar Concordant
description: A cross-species organization devoted to open trade, mutual aid, and intersystem reconstruction. One of the few groups to grow in the aftermath.

lore.history: Formed in the ashes of the Collapse, the Concordant banded together fleeing civilians, traders, scientists, and refugees into a faction built on cooperation.
lore.culture: Respect, negotiation, mutual aid. They believe unity is the only path to survival.
lore.goals: Maintain safe trade corridors, aid struggling worlds, prevent total species extinction.
lore.notes: Have access to rare pre-Surge trade archives and star maps.

name: Kaelori Ascendancy
description: Graceful psionic alien civilization with crystalline biology. The Surge damaged their Fold-relay network, leaving small enclaves scattered.
founded: Unknown; estimated millions of years old

lore.history: The Kaelori once maintained a serene pan-galactic network of crystalline data vaults. The Surge shattered most of their infrastructure, leaving them weakened but wise.
lore.culture: Harmony, long-term thinking, psionic resonance, and crystalline symbiosis.
lore.goals: Recover lost psionic archives, prevent further collapse, foster interspecies diplomacy.
lore.notes: Their ships produce almost no plasma wake, making them hard to detect.

name: Threxul Broodclades
description: A ruthless swarming civilization of biomechanical entities adapted to extreme radiation. They thrive in post-Surge environments and aggressively consume resources.

lore.history: The Surge didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t harm the ThrexulÃ¢â‚¬â€it empowered them. Radiation-rich regions serve as breeding grounds for new broodclades.
lore.culture: No individualism. Swarm logic. Expansion at any cost.
lore.goals: Feed. Reproduce. Consume all Fold-stable regions.
lore.notes: Their presence increases Surge radiation in-system.

name: United Terran Directorate
description: The fractured remains of the old Terran Government. Once spanning hundreds of systems, now reduced to scattered enclaves barely holding onto order.

lore.history: Once the dominant power in known space, the Directorate suffered catastrophic losses during the Surge. Entire fleets vanished. Worlds broke apart. Now they maintain a patchwork of strongholds.
lore.culture: Discipline, regulation, civic duty. Citizens are taught that humanity must rebuild through order and caution.
lore.goals: Restore stability, reclaim human space, and suppress extremist splinter groups.
lore.notes: Their heavy cruisers are some of the last pre-Surge military capital ships still functional.

name: Ashinari Blades
description: A remnant order of samurai-descended assassins and elite warriors who survived the Surge by retreating into monastic drifting fortresses. They uphold ancient codes of honour twisted by centuries of isolation.

lore.history: The Ashinari Sovereign Blades descend from the Ashina defense houses of Old Earth, who departed the planet centuries before the Surge. Their diaspora founded Ashinaris Prime, a world based around honour, ritual combat, and the preservation of warrior traditions. The Surge shattered their empire, leaving only drifting fortress-monasteries known as Void Dojos. Cut off, they evolved toward precision assassination, void-combat duelling, and clandestine justice.
lore.culture: Ashinari culture revolves around a strict code: The Eight Blades of Sovereignty — Duty, Discipline, Quietus, Sacrifice, Precision, Loyalty, Resolve, and Balance. Their speech is formal, their rituals complex, and their warriors undergo cybernetic augmentation blended with ancient martial discipline. Every Ashinari warrior crafts a 'Void-Katana', a plasma-edged weapon linked biometrically to its master.
lore.goals: To restore honour to the remnants of humanity by eliminating corruption, strengthening the worthy, and punishing those who 'dishonour the void'. They trade information reluctantly but strike fatal alliances when objectives align.
